chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy T Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Any assessments, counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy T Anderson in court with attorney Thomas j Kasen. Defendant Timothy T Anderson in custody. Robin K Zbikowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
BTC: 

15CF1822
Count 1- 5 Years WPS, 2 1/2 Years ic, 2 1/2 Years es

16CF1706
Count 1- 30 days RCJ, to run concurrent to 15CF1822

Count 3- 30 days RCJ, to run consecutive to count 1 but concurrent to 15CF1822

Conditions:
No drugs, no alcohol
AODA assessment & follow through with recommendations
$600 fine + cc on count 1 in 15CF1822
Provide a DNA Sample & pay surcharge on count 1 in 15CF1822
3 Years Drivers License Revocation
1 Year IID, upon licensure
Obtain & maintain employment
Court costs waived in 16CF1706 on count 1 & count 3, except the victim witness surcharge
FAW
VOTE
Any assessments, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent
Eligible for CIP & ERP

 **NOTE:  Defendant was in custody from 12-11-2015 until 2-18-2016 for a total of 69 days credit for time served.**

Defendant Timothy T Anderson in court with attorney Thomas j Kasen.  Defendant Timothy T Anderson in custody.  Robin K Zbikowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
St- Requesting an adjournment of the sentencing. The victim wanted to be present and was not able to take off of work on such short notice.
Def- Defendant would like to proceed with sentencing today.
BTC: Adjournment granted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy T Anderson in court with attorney Thomas j Kasen.  Defendant Timothy T Anderson in custody.  Robin K Zbikowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
Def- Requesting an adjournment of the sentencing.
St- No objection.
BTC: Adj  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: DEFENDANT TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING.

Defendant Timothy T Anderson in court with attorney Thomas j Kasen.  Defendant Timothy T Anderson in custody.  Robin K Zbikowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.
St- In 15CF1822 Plea to count 1; DRI count 2. In 16CF1706 Plea to count 1 & count 3 as charged; DRI count 2 & count 4.
Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1; DRI count 2 in 15CF1822 & count 1 & count 3 as charged; DRI count 2 & count 4 in 16CF1706. Order a PSI. Bond is revoked in 15CF1822.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Per Atty Kasen, PTC held on 16CF1706 deft requesting plea date - FPT converted to plea hearing

Status conference on September 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances - bond condition(s) to be monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc., located at 524 S Main Street in Racine (262-632-1780).  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive at all under any circumstances.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

***MODIFIED 2/17/16 TO INCLUDE: Defendant is not allowed in any taverns.

***MODIFIED 6/13/16 TO REMOVE SCRAM UNIT- DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO ZCI ONCE A MONTH TO TEST***
